mods_tasks_extraction.task_overview: Extract bibliographic metadata from the document image and structure it according to MODS 3.8 schema for standalone documents.

task.description: Extract the main title and subtitle of the document

look_for.item: Document title (usually prominent at the top)

task.notes: Title is mandatory. If no clear title exists, use a descriptive title in brackets.

task.description: Identify authors, creators, and contributing organizations
task.notes: Include role information (author, editor, publisher, creator). Use type="personal" or type="corporate" appropriately.

look_for.item: Genre clues (report, guideline, article, white paper, technical document)

task.notes: typeOfResource is typically "text". Genre should be specific to document type.
Use encoding="w3cdtf" for dates in YYYY-MM-DD format.
Use internetMediaType for digital formats. Include extent in human-readable form.
Include the full abstract text if available. If not, create a brief descriptive summary.

look_for.item: Main topics discussed in the document

task.notes: Use multiple subject elements for different topics. Include authority attribute if using controlled vocabularies (lcsh, mesh, etc.).
Use type attribute to specify identifier type (doi, uri, isbn, etc.).

task.description: Identify the language of the document

look_for.item: Text language (default to English if unclear)

task.notes: Use ISO 639-2b three-letter codes (eng, spa, fra, etc.).
Use type attribute to categorize notes (version, citation, etc.).

task.description: Document metadata about the MODS record itself

include.item: recordCreationDate - Current date in YYYY-MM-DD format
languageOfCataloging - Language used for cataloging (typically eng)

task.notes: This documents when and how the MODS record was created.

extraction_guidelines.guideline: Extract information in the order it appears in the document
Be conservative - only include information you can verify from the document
Use placeholder values like "Unknown" for required elements when information is not available
For standalone documents, do NOT create relatedItem type="host" structures
Do NOT include part elements with volume/issue/page numbers for standalone documents
If uncertain about information, include it in a note element with appropriate context
Maintain consistent formatting and follow MODS 3.8 schema requirements
